node.plaintext:
> Raspberry Pi can be set up without monitor and keyboard as headless setup and
how to set up Raspberry Pi without monitor and keyboard will be introduced as 5
steps.
Install Raspberry Pi OS
You can install Raspberry Pi OS on microSD card, USB memory stick or USB
external storage such as SSD/HDD that you need to update firmware.

Install Raspberry Pi Imager
Install Raspberry Pi Imager [https://www.raspberrypi.org/software/]from 
www.raspberrypi.org [https://www.raspberrypi.org/software/]

Install Raspberry Pi OS
Run Raspberry Pi Imager and choose OS. 

You can choose several OS and recommend Raspberry Pi OS (32-bit)

Click CHOOSE STORAGE

Select your storage from the menu

Then click WRITE. 

This takes several minutes as Raspberry Pi Imager downloads and burns selected
Raspberry Pi OS to selected storage.

Writing

Verifying

Completed

Set up SSH
SSH (Secure Socket Shell) is required to enable before you insert the storage
you installed Raspberry Pi OS into your Raspberry Pi. 

Open the boot folder of the installed storage

Create a file named "ssh" which is empty and no file extension in the boot
folder

If Raspberry Pi is connected to your network via wired connection, you don't
need to set up Wi-Fi and go to SSH connection to Raspberry Pi to enable VNC.

Set up Wi-Fi
To set up a Wi-Fi connection on your Raspberry Pi you need to put
wpa_supplicant.conf with following text in the boot folder you created "ssh"
file. 

ctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant GROUP=netdev
update_config=1
country=<Insert 2 letter ISO 3166-1 country code here>

network={
 ssid="<Name of your wireless LAN>"
 psk="<Password for your wireless LAN>"
}

Please refer to following example

ctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant GROUP=netdev
update_config=1
country=<Insert 2 letter ISO 3166-1 country code here>

network={
 ssid="nadaegyun"
 psk="iloveyou"
}

When Raspberry Pi first boots, it will copy that file into the correct location
in the Linux root file system and use those settings to start up Wi-Fi.

After Raspberry Pi is connected to power, make sure to wait a few minutes for it
to boot up and register on the network.

Getting Raspberry Pi IP address
To connect to your Raspberry Pi using SSH to enable VNC you need to know the IP
address of your Raspberry Pi. This is easy if you have a monitor.

Get the IP address from your router
You can check all IP addressses from the main menu of your router, probably
visit to http://192.168.1.1 and check IP address. 

Here is an example how I got the IP address of my Raspberry Pi.

Resolving raspberrypi.local with mDNS
Y [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avahi_%28software%29]
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicast_DNS]ou can reach your Raspberry Pi by
using its hostname.local and ping will show its IP address if it is reachable.

ping raspberrypi.local

PING raspberrypi.local (192.168.1.99): 56 data bytes
64 bytes from 192.168.1.131: icmp_seq=0 ttl=255 time=2.618 ms

nmap command
To use nmap to scan the devices on your network, you need to know the subnet you
are connected to. First find your own IP address, in other words the one of the
computer you're using to find your Pi's IP address:

nmap -sn 192.168.1.0/24

Ping scan just pings all the IP addresses to see if they respond. For each
device that responds to the ping, the output shows the hostname and IP address
like so:

Starting Nmap 6.40 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2014-03-10 12:46 GMT
Nmap scan report for hpprinter (192.168.1.2)
Host is up (0.00044s latency).
Nmap scan report for Gordons-MBP (192.168.1.4)
Host is up (0.0010s latency).
Nmap scan report for ubuntu (192.168.1.5)
Host is up (0.0010s latency).
Nmap scan report for raspberrypi (192.168.1.8)
Host is up (0.0030s latency).
Nmap done: 256 IP addresses (4 hosts up) scanned in 2.41 seconds

Getting the IP address of a Pi using your smartphone
The Fing app is a free network scanner for smartphones. It is available for 
Android
[https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.overlook.android.fing] and 
iOS [https://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/fing-network-scanner/id430921107?mt=8].

Your phone and your Raspberry Pi have to be on the same network, so connect your
phone to the correct wireless network.

When you open the Fing app, touch the refresh button in the upper right-hand
corner of the screen. After a few seconds you will get a list with all the
devices connected to your network. Scroll down to the entry with the
manufacturer "Raspberry Pi". You will see the IP address in the bottom left-hand
corner, and the MAC address in the bottom right-hand corner of the entry.

SSH connection to Raspberry to enable VNC
Now you can connect to your Raspberry Pi using SSH with the IP address of your
Raspberry Pi in terminal.

ssh pi@your Raspberry Pi IP address

Enter "raspberry" as default password

then your Raspberry Pi is connected by using SSH

Other configuration for headless Raspberry Pi
After SSH is connected to your Raspberry, some more configuration is required in
raspi-config.

 * Configuration tool update
 * Desktop auto login
 * Enable VNC
 * Virtual desktop display
 * Bootloader update for external USB storage

First, enter 'sudo raspi-config' in termal.

sudo raspi-config

Then you will see the main menu of Raspberry Pi software configuraiton Tool

Configuration tool update
First select 8 Update 

You will see update progress as below

Desktop auto login
select 1 System Option

S5 Boot / Auto Login

B4 Desktop Autologin Desktop GUI

Enable VNC
This will be enable VNC so that you can connect your Raspberry without Monitor
with RealVNC viewer [https://www.realvnc.com/en/connect/download/viewer/].

Select 3 Interface Options

Select P3 VNC

Select Yes to enable VNC

Now VNC is enable.

Virtual desktop display
To set up headless Raspberry Pi you need to use virtual desktop and enable HDMI
with some resolution. Otherwise you will see black screen when you connect to
your Raspberry Pi with VNC as below.

Select 6 Advanced Options

Select A8 HDMI / Composite

Select V1 Enable 4kp60 HDMI

After HDMI is enable then set resolution. Select 2 Display Options

Select D1 Resolution

Select DMT Mode 82 as recommendation

Boot loader update for external USB storage
If you don't use external USB storage, you don't need to.

Select 6 Advanced Options

Select A7 Bootloader Version

Select E1 Latest version boot ROM software

Latest version boot ROM will be loaded at next reboot.

Boot order also can be chosen in 6 Advanced Options

Select A6 Boot Order

You can choose your setting

Select <Finish> to apply changes

Select <Yes> to reboot.



Connect to Raspberry Pi using VNC
Install Realvnc viewer [https://www.realvnc.com/en/connect/download/viewer/] and
enter 'your Raspberry IP address'

Connecting to your Raspberry

Click Continue

Enter 'pi' and 'raspberry' as default

Finally headless Raspberry Pi has been completed if you see the following.

Now you can change resolution as you want. Click Raspberry Pi icon on the left
of top and go preferences and Screen configuration.

Click Configure, Screens, HDMI-1 and Resolution.Choose your favorite resolution
and apply.

Headless Raspberry Pi setting is completed.

I will add video clip for better understanding later.

node.title: 25.04.2021 - Sunny day
node.excerpt:
> Sunny day in Spring... I am planning to go camping with my wife and son in May
even though it will rain on the planned day. She says it would be first and last
time to go camping with me because normally lady does not like camping.
I just decided to keep the plan to go camping in raining day because nobody
knows it would be really raining, I mean no one knows future but we may
anticipate it based on simulation, calculation, experience, estimation and so
on. But nobody knows coming future.

node.plaintext:
> Sunny day in Spring... I am planning to go camping with my wife and son in May
even though it will rain on the planned day. She says it would be first and last
time to go camping with me because normally lady does not like camping.
I just decided to keep the plan to go camping in raining day because nobody
knows it would be really raining, I mean no one knows future but we may
anticipate it based on simulation, calculation, experience, estimation and so
on. But nobody knows coming future.

Photo by Pars Sahin
[https://unsplash.com/@byadoniaa?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
I hope this family camping we go first time would be remembered as a good
memory.

properties.alt: Dünya’nın Latin tarafı, saman hırsızlarının samanı çalarken dökmesiyle oluşan tanımı yani samanyolu’nu değil de Süt Yolu’nu (Milkyway) kullanıyor. Yunan Mitolojisi’nden kaynaklanan bir öyküsü var. Zeus, ölümlü bir kadından olan oğlunun yani Herakles’in üzerine titremektedir. Onun da ölümsüz olması için, kutsal eşi Hera uyurken oğlunun Hera’nın sütünü emmesi istiyor. Ama Hera uyanıyor ve o zamana kadar görmediği bir çocuğun memesini emmesini istemediği için, çocuğu savuruyor ve sütü fışkırarak süt yolunu oluşturuyor.
